alert.note: Alert for Upper Koyukuk Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued June 03 at 1:45PM AKDT until June 05 at 10:00PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING FOR UPPER KOYUKUK VALLEY... The National Weather Service in Fairbanks has issued a Fire Weather Watch, which is in effect from Saturday afternoon through Sunday evening. * AFFECTED AREA...South and east of Allakaket. * TIMING...Noon to 10 pm Saturday and again Sunday. * WINDS...East 10 to 15 mph with gusts up to 20 mph during the afternoon and into the evening hours. * HUMIDITY...As low as 15 percent. * TEMPERATURES...65 to 75. * IMPACTS...Rapid ignition, growth and spread of fires will be possible.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that weather conditions could lead to the potential for a Red Flag event in the near future. This watch will remain in effect until it is upgraded to a Red Flag Warning or that it is determined that the Red Flag event will not develop. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.
